result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A. Capelle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: DE pleads Guilty to Count #1:  Parties present and Court approves deferred judgment of conviction agreement for Ct #1,  Court accepts Guilty plea but Judgment of Conviction is not entered.  Conditions: DEF shall not engage in any violations of criminal laws of any State or the United States.  DEF shall comply with all terms of probation for the conviction in Ct #2.  NO CONTACT with victim J.A.R.  DE shall successfully complete sex offender treatment as recommended by DOC.  DE shall obtain high school equivalency degree.    AODA assessment  and follow-through with recommendations, including maintaining absolute sobriety.  Other detailed conditions as per signed document.

miscConds.notes: Fine:  $268 -   If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

1.) No contact with any female juveniles under the age of 17.  

2.) No contact with victim (J.A.R., dob: 1/30/2000).

1.)  Complete Moral/cognitive therapy and follow-through with recommendations.

2.)  Register as a sex offender
AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: 12 Months condiction jail time.  Credit for 59 days.  Eligible for Huber - following Sawyer County Jail regulations

supervisions.notes: Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years.  Conditions: Follow all terms of deferred judgment agreement, including  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.  Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or drug use.  NO CONTACT with victim J.A.R. Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent and complete sex offender treatment. Obtain high school equivalency degree.  Court costs $443 including DNA sample and surcharge.  DE is eligible to petition the court for expunction of Ct #2 if all conditions are sucessfully completed.

miscConds.notes: $443 court costs.  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge. 90 days county jail, With Huber, DE eligible for good time.

judgments.dispoDesc:
DE pleads Guilty to Ct #3.  Sentence is imposed:  90 days county jail, with Huber and DE is eligible for Good time.  Report to jail September 2, 2016 by 3:00 pm.    Pay statutory court costs $443 and DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge which is included in the costs.   DE is NOT eligible for expunction of Ct #3. 
Parties state DE has no jail credit.

records.addlTxt:
3:16PM   Judge John Anderson appears by video from Bayfield County.  Defendant Joseph A. Capelle in court, appearing in person while in custody, with attorney Chris A Gramstrup, appearing in person.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court indicates PSI has been filed.  Atty Gramstrup states PSI reviewed and not corrections.  State indicates PSI reviewed and no corrections.  State makes a statement, joint agreement to follow PSI.  Atty Gramstrup agrees.  State makes a statement prior to sentencing, reciting recommendation.  Court has discussion with Atty Gramstrup.  Court has discussion with State on victims / victim impact statement.  Atty Gramstrup makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF makes statement prior to sentencing.  Court makes statement, issues sentence.  State has nothing further.  Atty Gramstrup has nothing further.  Court addresses DEF.

COURT:  Withheld sentence - 30 months probation and 12 months conditional jail time, Huber eligible (following Sawyer County Jail regulations), with credit for 59 days.  Conditions:    AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations, Moral/cognitive therapy, register as a sex offender, no contact with any female juveniles under the age of 17, and no contact with victim (J.A.R., dob: 1/30/2000).  Fine/costs:  $518, which includes DNA surcharge.    DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  If probation / supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Letters of Support for Defendant
Letters of Support for Defendant
Attny Chris Gramstrup

09:40AM  Judge John Anderson appears by video from Bayfield County. Defendant Joseph A. Capelle in court, appearing by video from in custody from Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt, appearing by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reviews case.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes statement, makes motion to withdraw as counsel.  State makes statement on bond.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt has nothing further.  Court makes statement, conviction in place, held in custody until sentencing hearing.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes statement in support of motion to withdraw as counsel.  DEF indicates agreement with motion to withdraw.  Court grants motion to withdraw.  Court indicates sentencing hearing will remain on calendar.
Return on warrant on November 12, 2021 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph A. Capelle in court with attorney John Charles Bachman.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Amended Information.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds the state has complied with victim rights legislation.  
DE pleads Guilty to Count #1:  Parties present and Court approves deferred judgment of conviction agreement for Ct #1,  Court accepts Guilty plea but Judgment of Conviction is not entered.  DEF agrees to comply with the following conditions during the 3 YEAR period of this agreement : DEF shall not engage in any violations of criminal laws of any State or the United States.  DEF shall comply with all terms of probation for the conviction in Ct #2.  NO CONTACT with victim J.A.R.  DE shall successfully complete sex offender treatment as recommended by DOC.  DE shall obtain high school equivalency degree.    AODA assessment  and follow-through with recommendations, including maintaining absolute sobriety.  Other detailed conditions as per signed document.
DE pleads Guilty to Ct #2.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years.  Conditions: Follow all terms of deferred judgment agreement, including  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.  Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or drug use.  NO CONTACT with victim J.A.R. Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent and complete sex offender treatment. Obtain high school equivalency degree.  Court costs $443 including DNA sample and $200 surcharge.  DE is eligible to petition the court for expunction of Ct #2 if all conditions are sucessfully completed.  
DE pleads Guilty to Ct #3.  Sentence is imposed:  90 days county jail, with Huber and DE is eligible for Good time.  Report to jail September 2, 2016 by 3:00 pm.    Pay statutory court costs $443 and DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge which is included in the costs.   DE is NOT eligible for expunction of Ct #3. 
Parties state DE has no jail credit.
DE told to go to Sawyer County Jail/booking after court for DNA sample collection and fingerprinting.
